alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 3:36AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation and snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will produce blowing and drifting snow. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible in the most persistent lake snows across the Tug Hill. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph producing extensive blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Jefferson county. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM EST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult this morning. The combination of a wintry mix and rapidly falling temperatures last night will continue to produce icy and hazardous roads this morning, with snow accumulation on top of ice.
info.instruction: Periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will result in slippery roads and limited visibilities. Slow down and use caution while driving. Submit snow and ice reports through our website or social media. Narrow bands of heavy snow could impact portions of the region. Localized travel problems will be possible.
